intro: Schizoglossum stenoglossum subsp. flavum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered schizoglossum, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific alpine environments. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the brief alpine growing season. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils at high altitudes, where it is adapted to cold and harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
